==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
<div style="float:right;">
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}}
{{wikipedia|Tachibana}}
[[File:Japanese_Crest_Tachibana_Mamori.svg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|立花}} (''Tachibana''): the '''Tachibana''' {{m|en|kamon}} or family crest.]]
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|たち|はな|r=y|k2=ばな|yomi=k}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=たちばな|立ち|tr1=tachi|t1=standing|pos1=the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{m|ja|立つ}} ''tatsu'', “to stand”|花|tr2=hana|t2=flower}}.  {{rendaku2|sort=たちばな|hana|bana}}

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|たちばな}}<!-- Cannot currently find pitch accent for this spelling; 橘 is acc=2 -->

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|proper|たちばな}}

# {{surname|lang=ja|sort=たちばな}}
# any of various [[place name]]s
# a [[school]] or [[style]] of [[ikebana]]

=====Usage notes=====
The ''rikka'' reading may be more common for the [[ikebana]] school sense.

===Etymology 2===
<div style="float:right;clear:both;">
{{wikipedia|Rikka}}
[[File:Ikebana-Rikka.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|立花}} (''rikka'', ''tachibana''): a painting of an [[ikebana]] [[arrangement]] in the '''''Rikka''''' style.]]
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|りつ|k1=りっ|か}}
{{IPAchar|/rikkwa/}} → {{IPAchar|/rikka/}}

Possibly from {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=りっか}} compound {{m|zh|立花|tr=lip xwæ|lit=stand + flower}} or {{m|zh|立華|tr=lip xwæ|lit=stand + flower}}.

Alternatively, coined in Japan of {{etyl|ltc|-}}-derived components.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|りっか|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR,SMK5|acc2=0|acc2_ref=DJR}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|立華}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|りっか|hhira=りつくわ}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=りっか|Buddhism}} a [[style]] of [[floral]] [[arrangement]] as an [[offering]], typically using [[branch]]es of [[pine]] or [[plum]] placed [[upright]] in a [[copper]] [[vase]]

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|proper|りっか|hhira=りつくわ}}

# a [[school]] or [[style]] of [[ikebana]]
# an area in the city of {{w|Nagakute, Aichi}}
